Steps.Message: We became aware of this power cut at 09:00. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.
Steps.Name: We are restoring customers automatically

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Investigating & fixing

Steps.Message: All power in the area should be back on. We’re really sorry for any disruption this caused.
Steps.Name: Power back on

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We regularly inspect our electrical equipment to ensure it is safe and efficient. We need to examine 2 transformers on our electricity poles to check they are functioning properly. This essential work helps to provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, reducing the risk of any unplanned power cuts in the future as we appreciate some customers may have experienced several unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. To keep everyone safe while we carry out these works, we will need to temporarily turn off your electricity. We are taking extra measures to limit the time your power is off and we'll do our best to cause as little disruption as possible. Doing this will improve the reliability of the electricity network in the future. This work is taking place near Peartree Lane and Watling Street.

Our contractors have advised that the planned power cut has been postponed. This is due to operational restrictions meaning that the works cannot safely go ahead on this date. These works have been provisionally re-scheduled to the 12th November 2025 and you will receive new letters closer to the time. Our reference number for this is INCD-22728-O. We would like to apologise for any inconvenience this may cause you. If you have any questions or you have moved from the NR34 postcode area, then please give us a call on 105. VB & SMS sent.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Name: Power back on

We regularly inspect our electrical equipment to ensure it is safe and efficient. We need to examine 3 transformers on our electricity poles to check they are functioning properly. This essential work helps to provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, reducing the risk of any unplanned power cuts in the future. To keep everyone safe while we carry out these works, we will need to temporarily turn off your electricity. We are taking extra measures to limit the time your power is off and we'll do our best to cause as little disruption as possible. Doing this will improve the reliability of the electricity network in the future. This work is taking place in the Guildhall Lane area.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript:
This work is taking place on Bury Road.

To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we carry out regular inspections of trees
near our overhead cables. This has identified trees that have grown close, which could damage
the cables and affect your electricity supply. Please note there will be two way traffic lights on Bury
Road to ensure the works are carried out safely. Access to your property will always be provided.
Our engineers need to temporarily switch off your power so we can safely cut the trees away from
the cables. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future as we
appreciate your area has been impacted with unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript:
This work is taking place on Alderton Road .

To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we carry out regular inspections of our
equipment in your area. This has identified cables and 2 electricity poles that need upgrading.
Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future.
To complete the work safely, we need to turn your power off to upgrade the equipment. To ensure
the power is off for the shortest possible time, our contractors will be carrying out preparation
works prior to the power cut on the 10th and 11th November.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we carry out regular inspections of trees near our overhead cables. This has identified trees that have grown close, which could damage the cables and affect your electricity supply. We will also be replacing a pole mounted transformer with a new substation. Our engineers need to temporarily switch off your power so we can safely cut the trees away from the cables and install the substation. Doing this will improve the reliability of the network and reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future as we appreciate your area has been impacted with unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. This work is taking place on Four Oaks Farm and The Lodge.

To connect and disconnect the generator we will need to switch off your power temporarily.

This work is taking place in and around Kelvedon Road.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript:
This work is taking place near Pinesfield
Lane. 
To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we carry out regular inspections of trees
near our overhead cables. This has identified trees that have grown close, which could damage
the cables and affect your electricity supply.
Our contractors need to temporarily switch off your power so we can safely cut the trees away
from 2 sections of cables. We appreciate that some customers may have experienced unplanned
power cuts and a planned power cut in the last 6 months. Doing this will reduce the risk of you
having an unplanned power cut in the future.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we carry out regular inspections of trees near our overhead cables. This has identified trees that have grown close, which could damage the cables and affect your electricity supply. Our engineers need to safely cut the trees away from 6 sections cables.  During this time, you will be connected to a generator to provide you with electricity whilst we carry out the works. To connect and disconnect the generator we will need to switch off your power temporarily. This work will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future as we appreciate some customers may have experienced unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. This work is taking place near Rattlesden Road.

Steps.Message:
Hi again, Ebony here. Following on from my last message, I wanted to let you know that over the next few weeks, you may still see us in the Neville Rd area whilst we repair and improve the network.
 
Today we will be preparing the ground for tarmac, which will be put down over the weekend. Then, over the next two weeks, we will be replacing your local substation. This means there may be some disruption however we are not expecting you to experience any power cuts. Thank you for your continued patience whilst we restore everything back to normal.
 
If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to call us on 08003163105. If you need to speak with someone relating to any outstanding damaged equipment in your home, please call Haste on 01730 897100
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Hi I'm Ebony and I'm the manager of the text messaging team at UK Power Networks. You may notice that we have less of our teams, vehicles and partners on site after today. Our customer champions will be on site until mid afternoon. I wanted to offer you personal reassurance that even though we have less physical presence on site, our partners Haste will still be working through each property to repair, or replace damaged equipment. Should you need to speak to Haste, they can be contacted on 01730 897100. As this will be the final message from my team, I extend a final and sincere apology for the inconvenience caused to you, from what has been a very uncommon and complex fault.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Simon at 08:29 - Hi again. I just wanted to let you know that our Customer Champions are back on site again this morning to answer any questions that you may have. As we said before, repairs to our network following the fault have been completed, but there are still properties without power as our staff and contractors are visiting properties individually to carry out safety tests. You can still reach us on the phone, but if you would rather speak to someone face to face feel free to approach them, they are there to help! If your power is restored now, you can stop SMS updates on our website here - https://bit.ly/348KOZ3
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our staff have now arrived on site in the Benedict Way N2 area. They will start running tests at our substation to see how the local network is operating.

It's quite common for power to be restored briefly and go off again; this is our engineers using testing equipment to energise different sections of our network - this helps to narrow down any possible issues.

Our cabling network is often broken down by smaller sites, and our staff may also check these to test for any problems, and they may also walk the cabling route to see if there are any signs of malfunction that have appeared on the surface. Our time frame hasn't been adjusted, so for now I'll let you know more news as soon as our staff update us.

We're doing this work as it's essential to provide reliable electricity supplies to your area. We're sorry for any inconvenience caused and thank you for your patience.
MainMessage: We have repaired the problem with the electricity supply in your area. There may still be some tidying up to do, and any details have been passed to our Maintenance department, who will attend to it as soon as possible. Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

Steps.Message: We became aware of a power cut at 10:04. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly.
Steps.Name: Reported

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Investigating & fixing

Steps.Message: All power in the area should be back on. We’re really sorry for any disruption this caused.
Steps.Name: Power back on

Steps.Message:
Sent by Simon at 23:12 - We can now confirm that all power in the area should be back on. Our engineers had to unexpectedly turn off the power to safely repair a fault with a piece of underground network equipment in the The Green area.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Simon at 22:03 - We are sorry to have to let you know that it's going to take us a little longer than we expected to get all the power back on in the area. Our engineers have advised that the repairs have been delayed due to inclement weather.

Therefore, we're now aiming to restore supplies between 23:00 and 00:00. We're sorry we've had to change the estimated time, but we'll keep you updated.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hi, this is Simon - I wanted to let you know I have just taken over for the night shift, so I'll be here until tomorrow morning making sure you have the latest news from our staff.

I know that power being off may be especially worrying for you as we head later into the evening, but our field teams work 24 hours so I'll let know further news as soon as it comes in.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Hi, I'm Stephanie and I am the manager of the text messaging team at UK Power Networks in Ipswich. Today's power cut was unexpected, so we were unable to provide you with prior notice to help you plan ahead. I am pleased to confirm that we managed to resolve this by diverting power to get your lights back on as soon as possible. Just so you know, we text customers when we are made aware of problems like this, so if you would like to be notified in the future you can do so here https://bit.ly/3zyHC6L. This was a widespread problem on the underground network and I personally apologise for any disruption this has caused to your day. If you have any questions or are still without power, please call us on 105.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Simon at 23:29 - We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 765 customers in the Potters Bar, EN6 4 area, by diverting power around an underground cable fault. We understand how difficult a power cut can be, we're sorry for any disruption or worry this unplanned power cut caused you.   

If your power isn't back on we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be worrying, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on. If you have any concerns or questions, give us a call any time.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Simon at 22:31 - We're sorry for the disruption to your power today, we appreciate how disruptive this must be for you, especially for those who may be more vulnerable without the electric. If you're worried about an elderly or ill person in your property who is affected by the power cut today, we are able to provide some support. For more information just click here: https://bit.ly/40quttu If you have any further concerns or questions though, don't hesitate to call us free on 08003163105. We'll continue to keep you updated with our engineer's progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Luke at 20:17 - We're pleased to report that all power in the Uckfield area should now be restored. Our engineers have now safely connected temporary generators and these will be providing your power while our engineers work to fully repair the unexpected high voltage fault.

Depending on what the issue is, it may take a few days for our engineers to plan in the work and make their repairs, but once this is completed safely the generators can be removed, and network power will be resumed.

If you'd like any further information, or if your power is not restored, please call us any time on 08003163105.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Thanks for bearing with us during the power cut today, our staff will work to restore your power as quickly and as safely as possible. A lot of our customers have questions regarding power cuts, and though you can always reach our team, you can also find some helpful information and answers to some of our most frequently asked questions on our website here - https://bit.ly/3pTfAz9 - Bear in mind this will use your mobile data, so feel free to speak to us if you'd prefer. We'll be in touch again once we have more information from our staff.
